data.title: DeserializerManager should throw an error if a registered deserializer returns undefined
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

This drove me up the wall while trying to figure out why deserialization wasn't working in the rewritten about package (damn you CoffeeScript implicit returns!) – deserializer functions must return an object, but we currently don't provide any feedback to package authors that this is the case. We should either throw an error or log a warning to make this clearer, and also update the docs [here](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.8.0/DeserializerManager#instance-add) to specify the expected return value of a deserializer.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.10.0-dev-e8f1591
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

data.title: Atom crash with low system memory message
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
  Not so far, although I am now using Atom in safe mode
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
  Atom 1.8.0
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Atom crashed twice in a week with multiple open tabs during editing of simple text file.
The cursor stops responding to commands, then stops blinking, then a warning message appears informing that 'The editor has crashed'. The second time a system warning message informed that there was not enough memory to analyse the problem and send a report.

At present I am trying Atom in safe mode and monitoring it.

![screenshot from 2016-07-31 14 41 15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15718033/17276747/7d1538d2-5732-11e6-9365-5ffcec0cea95.png)
### Steps to Reproduce

Before I did not experience any issue.
Moreover I did not change my usual configuration, and the editor started to crash during simple tasks, like editing a text file.

My installed packages are:

Core Packages (77)
Community packages: file-icons, linter, linter-ruby

Installed themes:

Core themes (12)
Community themes: dark-flat-ui, outlander-syntax

Along with Atom, other running applications are:

Firefox: two windows with about 12 tabs each
terminal (inactive)
Files (file manager)
Document viewer (pdf viewer)
SMPlayer
Audacious

Only Atom actually crashes

**Expected behavior:** normal functioning

**Actual behavior:** crash
### Versions

me@SATELLITE-L50-A-161:~ $ atom --version
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

me@SATELLITE-L50-A-161:~ $ apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.6
git 2.9.2

OS: Ubuntu 14.04.4 LTS
Memory: 5,7 GiB
hard disk: 16,4 GB used, 444,3 GB free

me@SATELLITE-L50-A-161:~ $ top
KiB Mem:   5983776 total,  4000268 used,  1983508 free,   302832 buffers
KiB Swap:  6163452 total,   202924 used,  5960528 free.   901984 cached Mem

Notebook: Toshiba satellite L50-A-161

data.title: New way of naming component or zipped package...
data.body:
Hi all,

I have used Atom for a few weeks and really love it. I found that there is a portable version of Atom to use in the USB sticks (at Sourceforge). I copied the files in ~ .atom folder the respective folder in the USB so that all plugins are available to use for the portable version.

However I have encountered problems:
1. Plugins sometime have filename/path exceed 256 chars. Using explorer copy function doesn't work.
2. Update of plugins, for both of installed and portable version sometime took too long to complete.

My question are:

Is there any kind of **_"enhance proposal"_** or **standard** to make Atom more convenient in handling components/plugins? For example, all plugin are packed in a zip-based archives so that installation and update of these stuffs become more convenient and faster. It also make disk access faster someway because normally there are too many files in the plugin folder.

Thanks!

TN

Much better if just put those keybindings into menu.

data.title: overriding keymap.cson (up and down keystrokes) causes keystrokes to be cached
data.body:
### Description

Overriding basic keys, causes the keystroke that was overridden needing to be pressed twice, which in turns seems to 'cache' the previous keystroke.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. override ~/.atom/keymap.cson with contents:

'body':
  'ctrl-i': 'core:move-up'
  'ctrl-k': 'core:move-down'
1. Restart editor
   using ctrl-i and ctrl-k to move cursor results in a 'delay' of one keystroke upon first time using that keystroke.  So ctrl-i then pressing 'end' key would result it this situation:

Initial:
`line 1`
`line <cursor is here> 2`
`line 3`

First keystroke:
`line 1`
`line <press ctrl-i here> 2`
`line 3`

Result (cursor moves up a line as expected):
`line <cursor moves here as expected> 1`
`line 2`
`line 3`

Second keystroke:
`line <now press ctrl+k here> 1`
`line 2`
`line 3`

Expect:
`line <cursor is still here> 1`
`line <expect cursor to be here> 2`
`line 3`

Third keystroke (the 'cached' keystroke)
`line <press end key> 1`
`line 2`
`line 3`

Result:
`line <press end key> 1`
`line 2 <cursor is now at end of line2>`
`line 3`

I've tried using different keystrokes but they all seem to have the same issue.

I'm running Linux:

Linux jasona-desktop 3.16.0-30-generic #40-Ubuntu SMP Mon Jan 12 22:06:37 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

And atom (in --safe mode):

Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

data.title: Crashes when a file contains more than 1000 lines
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

When I open a big PHP file (for example, one of [Xsolla files](https://github.com/xsolla/xsolla-sdk-php/blob/master/src/API/Resources/xsolla-2015-07-23.php)) and press Enter (to create new line) on line number 1500+, Atom brakes and sometimes crashed when amount of text is bigger.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a big PHP file
2. Scroll to a line 1500+
3. Focus on line and press Enter to create a new line.

**Expected behavior:** Atom don't brakes (for example, Sublime Text doesn't brake).

**Actual behavior:** Atom brakes
### Versions

OS X El Capitan
10.11.5

Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.7.4

data.title: Atom 1.8.0 Fails to start on RHEL 7.2
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Fresh installation of Atom 1.8.0 from RPM does not load when opned via x2go client.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Fresh install of Atom 1.8.0 RPM from Releases on RHEL 7.2
2. Open an XFCE (or any other desktop) with x2go client
   2b. Alternatively, try and load as a single app. It won't work
3. attempt to start via CLI or X from within that x2go session
4. Atom will not load

**However, it does work via X forwarding**

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

Atom editor will load in a full X environment

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

[jscalia@x2g1-dpmgmt-smq ~]$ atom -f
[4461:0729/141655:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(203)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/LinuxSUIDSandboxDevelopment for more information on developing with the sandbox on.
App load time: 506ms
[4461:0729/141656:ERROR:browser_main_parts.cc(116)] X IO error received (X server probably went away)

or

[jscalia@x2g1-dpmgmt-smq ~]$ atom
[jscalia@x2g1-dpmgmt-smq ~]$ App load time: 462ms

nothing further happens
### Versions

[jscalia@x2g1-dpmgmt-smq ~]$ atom --version && apm --version
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.5
git 1.8.3.1

[jscalia@x2g1-dpmgmt-smq ~]$ cat /etc/redhat-release 
Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.2 (Maipo)

[jscalia@x2g1-dpmgmt-smq ~]$ rpm -q atom && rpm -qi atom
atom-1.8.0-0.1.fc21.x86_64
Name        : atom
Version     : 1.8.0
Release     : 0.1.fc21
Architecture: x86_64
Install Date: Fri 29 Jul 2016 01:40:07 PM EDT
Group       : Unspecified
Size        : 238730707
License     : MIT
Signature   : (none)
Source RPM  : atom-1.8.0-0.1.fc21.src.rpm
Build Date  : Mon 06 Jun 2016 05:42:16 PM EDT
Build Host  : d9f210119bf3
Relocations : /usr 
URL         : https://atom.io/
Summary     : A hackable text editor for the 21st Century.
Description :
A hackable text editor for the 21st Century.

Thanks!

data.title: Atom doesn't automatically refresh archive hosted in another machine
data.body:
When editing files hosted in another machine, if the file changes (outside Atom), then it will not refresh them, not even signalize that they are out-date. There isn't also an option to force the refresh of the file (os is there?). This is very annoying when I can change the file outside atom (for instance by updating my repository).

Other editors detect when the file changes, signalize it and offer the user the ability to reload it, or to overwrite it.
- the autorefresh mechanism **works when working on files hosted on the same machine**.
- I'm on OS X El Capitan
- I'm using **samba** to mount the external files in my machine.
  
  atom --version
  Atom    : 1.8.0
  Electron: 0.36.8
  Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
  Node    : 5.1.1

data.title: Delete Obsolete Code
data.body:
This pull-request gets rid of `RowMap` along with its specs (after the transition to `DisplayLayer` we don't need this object anymore). It also deletes `spec/random-editor-spec.coffee`, because the tested behavior is already extensively covered in text-buffer (specifically, in `DisplayLayer` tests).

/cc: @atom/core

atom crashed with sigsegv in V8:string::newFromutf8()

data.title: Searching for "git" fails
data.body:
Probably more of a package manager server problem, but who knows.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to "Settings" -> "Install"
2. Enter "git"
3. Hit "Enter"

**Expected behavior:** Find all packages relevant to git, or at least an articulated "Too many results error".

**Actual behavior:** An error like this:
`Searching for “git” failed.
Unexpected end of input: [{...`
(thousands of lines of JSON follow, with package description data)
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

1.8.0 on Linux Gentoo.

data.title: Add JS style guide to the Contributing guide
data.body:
This PR adds a section for JavaScript style to the Contributing guide, based on feedback from https://github.com/atom/about/pull/35.

👀 @atom/feedback @nathansobo

data.title: 提交一个中文无法输入的问题
data.body:
正在使用的是1.8.0版本，发现中文无法输入，1.7.x版本没有此问题，
重现问题的办法就是安装个中文输入法，然后输入。

data.title: Atom settings being resetting randomly when memory is full and starts swapping .
data.body:
This is 3rd time , after computer restart atom's settings (every single setting) being resetted to default including re-enabling disabled packages .

It is very annoying. Just launching atom from commandline (as usual) is causing this.
And reproducing it is unreliable. It happens sometimes after restarting Laptop.

Atom : 1.8.0
OS : Sabayon Linux KDE , Kernel 4.6.0

data.title: Atom 1.8:  opening python file results in a currently open worksheet (of a different pythong file) being overwritten rather than an automatic creation of a new worksheet
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

opening python file results in a currently open worksheet (of a different pythong file) being overwritten rather than an automatic creation of a new worksheet

see attached screenshot 

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2601236/17226473/aec9b392-54d7-11e6-835d-27d9ceec82b6.png)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. [First Step]
2. [Second Step]
3. [and so on...]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: when opening a file with a line number, atom should scroll down to display that line number at the top of the view
data.body:
### Description

When opening atom from the command line, to a specific file and line number, atom does not scroll the content in the most desirable manner...
### Steps to Reproduce
1. atom text/someFile.txt:115

**Expected behavior:** I expect Atom to scroll so that line number 115 is at the top of my editor

**Actual behavior:** Atom scrolls to the line number, but only far enough for it to be presented at the bottom of the screen. Furthermore, plugins like JSHint that are displayed at the bottom will cover the desired line number. Therefore, the user still has to scroll the content to view the line number, defeating the entire purpose of this feature.
### Versions

$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

data.title: The size of editor's scrollbar can not change
Version 1.9.0-beta1 hangs and crashes on files only a few megabytes or tens of megabytes in size.
data.body: I would not call these files large.  Atom 1.9.0-beta1 (and earlier) can only do tiny files.  I think this issue should have the highest priority.

data.title: Fix regression where spacebar scrolled elements containing editors
data.body: Fixes atom/settings-view#767

data.title: Atom changes file's executable bit when saving a file hosted in a network filesystem
data.body:
When editing files that are mounted in a network file system the "Save" operation will set the file's "Executable Bit".

This issue happens when I mount an external directory on my Mac (El Capitan 10.11.5). This external volume is hosted on a unix machine (CentOS release 5.11 (Final)), and is provided via "smb".

Another related problem, is that when the files are changed outside the editor, they won't be refreshed.

Neither of the problems happen with **local files**

atom --version
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

data.title: Debian Jessie build problem Installing apm,  npm: not found
data.body:
```
$ git checkout $(git describe --tags `git rev-list --tags --max-count=1`)
HEAD is now at 57b8f81... 1.9.0-beta1

$ ./script/build
Node: v0.12.15
npm: v2.15.1
Installing build modules...
=> Took 17261ms.

Installing apm...
/bin/sh: 1: /atom/build/node_modules/.bin/npm: not found
```

data.title: Make Atom executable as a standard Electron app
data.body:
This pull-request converts the main script (and all the files that it requires) into standard javascript files so that Atom can be started like a standard Electron application, e.g.:

```
./electron/Electron.app/Contents/MacOS/Electron .
```

/cc: @atom/core

data.title: Atom Helper crashed
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

i normally used the editor, placed the cursor on another line with the mouse, than it hangs and finally crashed. the bad thing is that my unsaved documents are lost, but the saved ones are fine. i hope the crash report helps.

https://davidak.basecom.de/paste/?697ce85863f6f098#iP9oxwL1DMHNgVjipgp7EYIKiq3u9fqJbYcnkKY03ck=

from system log:

```
Jul 26 11:50:53 unibook-2.local Atom[10849]: XPC error messaging com.apple.IconServicesAgent: Connection interrupted
Jul 26 11:50:53 unibook-2.local Atom[10849]: XPC error messaging com.apple.IconServicesAgent: Connection invalid
Jul 26 15:29:26 unibook-2.local ReportCrash[30557]: Saved crash report for Atom Helper[10854] version 1.8.0 (1.8.0) to /Users/davidak/Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports/Atom Helper_2016-07-26-152926_unibook-2.crash
Jul 26 15:30:36 unibook-2.local Atom[30629]: App load time: 561ms
Jul 26 15:47:13 unibook-2.local Atom[30629]: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
Jul 26 15:47:13 unibook-2.local Atom[30629]: TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
        at AtomApplication.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/browser/atom-application.js:707:40)
        at AtomApplication.module.exports.AtomApplication.openPaths (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/browser/atom-application.js:712:10)
        at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/browser/atom-application.js:1040:24
        at Function.wrappedCallback (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom.asar/browser/api/lib/dialog.js:78:14)
```
### Steps to Reproduce

happened only once

**Expected behavior:**

stable textedior

**Actual behavior:**

crash, data loss
### Versions

Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.9
git 1.9.5

OS X 10.9.5
